>I'm starting to learn C++. I would like to do some
>simple 2-D graphics, and I don't know what's
>available.

I would recommend one of two libraries:-

1. SDL (the Simple Directmedia Layer, www.libsdl.org) which is open 
source and portable to just about everything, along with the SDL_gfx 
library which adds the usual line, circle, etc. graphics primitives. 
There are lots of other libraries which add bells and whistles and a 
large user-base. This is the library I'm using at the moment.

...or...

2. Allegro (http://www.talula.demon.co.uk/allegro/) which has high-level 
graphics primitives built in, and therefore needs less work to get it 
working than SDL, but it's less portable. Porting between Windows and 
Linux shouldn't be too hard, though. It has a smaller user-base, but 
there is help out there if you need it.

--Darren
